fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.rawtext

Class RawText

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.rawtext.RawTextPart<RawText>
      • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.rawtext.RawText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<RawTextPart>, org.json.simple.JSONAware

    public class RawText
extends RawTextPart<RawText>
    RawText provides a tool to construct rich-formatted texts in Minecraft using the builder pattern.

    It follows the same logic as Minecraft's JSON format. Example of use:

         RawText text = new RawText()
                      .then("I ")
                      .then("am ")
                          .color(ChatColor.RED)
                          .hover("This is displayed as a tooltip")
                          // .command executes directly while .suggest puts
                          // the command into the chat
                          .suggest("/say Hi there")
                      .then("BOLD")
                          .color(ChatColor.DARK_GREEN)
                          .style(ChatColor.BOLD)
                          .uri("http://perdu.com")
                          .hover(
                              new RawText()
                                  .then("Tooltips")
                                      .color(ChatColor.YELLOW)
                                  .then("\ncan be rich text too!")
                           )
                      .build();

    See the javadoc below to check out all the possibilities and methods available.

    A lot of methods in QuartzLib accepts RawText instances where a text is required, like MessageSender, RawMessage, Titles…

    Please note—due to the way this works, if you want to create progressively a raw text using this, you'll have to store the unfinished variable into a RawTextPart<?> variable. Example:

         RawTextPart text = new RawText().then("The beginning").color(ChatColor.RED);
     text.then("… and the end").color(ChatColor.DARK_GREEN).insert("The end is far");

     RawMessage.broadcast(text.build());

                                          String str)
        Converts a Minecraft-formatted string (with formatters like §a) to a raw text component.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The formatters delimiter (vanilla Minecraft uses §)
        str - The string to convert.
        Returns:
        The RawText equivalent.
